alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:58AM CDT until July 24 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL JO DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN CARROLL...CENTRAL JACKSON AND CENTRAL DUBUQUE COUNTIES... At 1257 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tennyson to Emeline, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management and surface observations. At 1253 AM, a 67 MPH wind gust was reported at the Dubuque Regional Airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Galena, Asbury, Bellevue, East Dubuque, Hanover, Elizabeth, Andrew, Scales Mound, La Motte, Menominee, Sherrill, Springbrook, Council Hill, St. Donatus, Centralia, Sageville, Bernard, Zwingle and Durango. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
